intro: Draba × ambigua, commonly known as the hybrid rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its hybrid origin, Draba × ambigua exhibits a variety of morphological traits that can vary between populations.
